title: Particle motion from acceleration function part - c

content.description: A particle moves along the x-axis in such a way that its acceleration at time t for t ≥ 0 is given by a(t)=4cos(2t) . At time t = 0 , the velocity of the particle is v(0)=1 and its position is x(0)=0 .
content.question: For what values of t , <math> <mrow> <mn> 0 </mn> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> π </mi> </mrow> </math> , is the particle at rest?

frqParts.text: For what values of t , <math> <mrow> <mn> 0 </mn> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> π </mi> </mrow> </math> , is the particle at rest?

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
